bartMachine

Class bartMachineClassification

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class bartMachineClassification
extends bartMachineRegression
    The class that is instantiated to build a binary classification BART model
    Author:
    Adam Kapelner and Justin Bleich

    • Method Detail

      • DoOneGibbsSample

        protected void DoOneGibbsSample()
        A Gibbs sample for binary classification BART is a little different than for regression BART. We no longer sample sigsq's. We instead SampleZs(), the latent variables that allow us to estimate the prob(Y = 1).
        Overrides:
        DoOneGibbsSample in class bartMachine_e_gibbs_base

      • SampleZs

        private void SampleZs()
        We sample the latent variables, Z, for each of the n observations
        See Also:
        2.3 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

      • SampleZi

        private double SampleZi(double g_x_i,
              double y_i)
        We sample one latent variable, Z_i
        See Also:
        2.3 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

      • SetupGibbsSampling

        protected void SetupGibbsSampling()
        Sets up Gibbs sampling. We should also blank out the vector gibbs_samples_of_sigsq with dummy values.
        Overrides:
        SetupGibbsSampling in class bartMachine_d_init

      • calculateHyperparameters

        protected void calculateHyperparameters()
        Calculates the hyperparameters needed for binary classifcation BART. This only need hyper_sigsq_mu
        Overrides:
